DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to investigate whether a combination of intensive training of visual-spatial abilities (LOCATO task) with anodal transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) leads to an improvement of learning and memory in healthy older adults and to examine the underlying neuronal mechanism.
DOC.brief_title: Modulation of Visual-Spatial Learning in Healthy Older Adults by tDCS
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria (old healthy controls): right handedness unobtrusive neuropsychological screening age: 5090 years severe internal or psychiatric disease epilepsy other severe neurological diseases, e.g. previous major stroke or brain tumor DMSIV manifest dementia contraindication for MRT (claustrophobia, metallic implants, tattoos)
